CA2208.fullDescription: A call is made to the default (parameterless) constructor of an exception type that is or derives from ArgumentException, or an incorrect string argument is passed to a parameterized constructor of an exception type that is or derives from ArgumentException.

CA2254.shortDescription: Template should be a static expression
CA2254.fullDescription: The logging message template should not vary between calls.

CS0472.shortDescription: The result of the expression is always the same since a value of this type is never equal to 'null'

CS1998.shortDescription: Async method lacks 'await' operators and will run synchronously

CS8618.shortDescription: Non-nullable field must contain a non-null value when exiting constructor. Consider declaring as nullable.

CS8625.shortDescription: Cannot convert null literal to non-nullable reference type.

S101.shortDescription: Types should be named in PascalCase
S101.fullDescription: Shared naming conventions allow teams to collaborate efficiently.

S1125.shortDescription: Boolean literals should not be redundant
S1125.fullDescription: A boolean literal can be represented in two different ways: true or false. They can be combined with logical operators (!, &&, ||, ==, !=) to produce logical expressions that represent truth values. However, comparing a boolean literal to a variable or expression that evaluates to a boolean value is unnecessary and can make the code harder to read and understand. The more complex a boolean expression is, the harder it will be for developers to understand its meaning and expected behavior, and it will favour the introduction of new bugs.

S125.shortDescription: Sections of code should not be commented out
S125.fullDescription: Commented-out code distracts the focus from the actual executed code. It creates a noise that increases maintenance code. And because it is never executed, it quickly becomes out of date and invalid.

S1481.shortDescription: Unused local variables should be removed
S1481.fullDescription: An unused local variable is a variable that has been declared but is not used anywhere in the block of code where it is defined. It is dead code, contributing to unnecessary complexity and leading to confusion when reading the code. Therefore, it should be removed from your code to maintain clarity and efficiency.

S2068.fullDescription: Because it is easy to extract strings from an application source code or binary, credentials should not be hard-coded. This is particularly true for applications that are distributed or that are open-source.

S2094.fullDescription: There is no good excuse for an empty class. If it’s being used simply as a common extension point, it should be replaced with an interface. If it was stubbed in as a placeholder for future development it should be fleshed-out. In any other case, it should be eliminated.

S2583.shortDescription: Conditionally executed code should be reachable
S2583.fullDescription: Conditional expressions which are always true or false can lead to unreachable code.

S3427.shortDescription: Method overloads with default parameter values should not overlap
S3427.fullDescription: The rules for method resolution can be complex and may not be fully understood by all developers. The situation becomes even more challenging when dealing with method overloads that have optional parameter values.

S3928.shortDescription: Parameter names used into ArgumentException constructors should match an existing one
S3928.fullDescription: Some constructors of the ArgumentException, ArgumentNullException, ArgumentOutOfRangeException and DuplicateWaitObjectException classes must be fed with a valid parameter name. This rule raises an issue in two cases:

S4144.shortDescription: Methods should not have identical implementations
S4144.fullDescription: Two methods having the same implementation are suspicious. It might be that something else was intended. Or the duplication is intentional, which becomes a maintenance burden.

S4487.fullDescription: Private fields which are written but never read are a case of "dead store". Changing the value of such a field is useless and most probably indicates an error in the code.

S5122.shortDescription: Having a permissive Cross-Origin Resource Sharing policy is security-sensitive
S5122.fullDescription: Having a permissive Cross-Origin Resource Sharing policy is security-sensitive. It has led in the past to the following vulnerabilities:

S6608.shortDescription: Prefer indexing instead of "Enumerable" methods on types implementing "IList"
S6608.fullDescription: Indexes in C# provide direct access to an element at a specific position within an array or collection. When compared to Enumerable methods, indexing can be more efficient for certain scenarios, such as iterating over a large collection, due to avoiding the overhead of checking the underlying collection type before accessing it.

S6966.fullDescription: In an async method, any blocking operations should be avoided.
